mainMenu

Class MenuItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • mainMenu.MenuItem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Coffee, Donut

    public abstract class MenuItem
extends java.lang.Object
    The MenuItem class is an abstract class to work as a framework so other classes can hold details about the item's specific details. This class is the parent of both Donut and Coffee.
    Author:
    Jah C. Speed, Abe Vitangcol

        public MenuItem()

    • Method Detail

      • getAmount

        public int getAmount()
        Returns the amount the order has for this specific order.
        Returns:
        The amount the order has listed.

      • getItemName

        public java.lang.String getItemName()
        Returns the name of the item, usually defined by the type of donut or coffee.
        Returns:
        The name of the item, generally coffee or one of the three donut types, in string format.

      • getPrice

        public double getPrice()
        Returns the unit price of the item.
        Returns:
        The price of the item. Amount is not factored for this one, in $##.## amount.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type of this item, usually defined as a black coffee or a specific donut flavor.
        Returns:
        The type of this item.

      • isEqual

        public int isEqual(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if an object of interest is equal to this object.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object of interest to see if it is the same as this one.
        Returns:
        0 if the objects are equal or the same, -1 otherwise.

      • itemPrice

        public double itemPrice()
        Returns the total price of the item.
        Returns:
        The total price of the item, which is seen by doing individual price * amount in $##.## amount.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns this object into a readable string format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string in "Item: (ITEMNAME) | Flavor: (ITEMTYPE) | Quantity: (AMOUNT)" format.
